org.mokai.persist.jdbc
Class OutboundInboundHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.mokai.persist.jdbc.OutboundInboundHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageHandler
public class OutboundInboundHandler
extends Object
implements MessageHandler

A MessageHandler implementation useful when we want to split inbound and outbound messages in different tables. It uses two MessageHandler implementations: one for handling outbound messages and the other for handling inbound messages.

A restriction of this handler is that you must provide both inbound and outbound handlers. You cannot leave one of those in null.

Author:
German Escobar

supportsDirection

public final boolean supportsDirection(Message.Direction direction)
                                throws IllegalStateException
Returns true if the direction is Direction#INBOUND or Direction#OUTBOUND. False otherwise.

Specified by:
supportsDirection in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
direction - the direction to be tested.
Returns:
true if it supports the direction of the message, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if at least one of the handlers is null.
See Also:
Message.Direction

insertMessage

public final long insertMessage(Connection conn,
                                Message message)
                         throws SQLException,
                                RejectedException,
                                IllegalStateException
If the direction of the message is Direction#OUTBOUND, it uses the outbound handler. If the direction is Direction#INBOUND, it uses the inbound handler.

Specified by:
insertMessage in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
conn - the Connection used to insert the message.
message - the message to be inserted.
Returns:
the generated id of the inserted message.
Throws:
RejectedException - if the direction of the messages is not outbound or inbound.
IllegalStateException - if at least one of the handlers is null.
SQLException - if something goes wrong.

updateMessagesStatus

public final void updateMessagesStatus(Connection conn,
                                       MessageCriteria criteria,
                                       byte newStatus)
                                throws SQLException,
                                       IllegalStateException
If the direction is null, it updates the status in both handlers, otherwise, if the direction is Direction#OUTBOUND, it uses only the outbound handler, if it is Direction#INBOUND, it uses only the inbound handler.

Specified by:
updateMessagesStatus in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
conn - the Connection used to update the status of the messages.
criteria - the criteria used to select the messages that are going to be updated.
newStatus - the new status for the messages.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if at least one of the handlers is null.
SQLException - if something goes wrong.

listMessages

public final Collection<Message> listMessages(Connection conn,
                                              MessageCriteria criteria)
                                       throws SQLException,
                                              IllegalStateException
If the direction is null, it retrieves the messages from both handlers, otherwise, if the direction is Direction#OUTBOUND, it retrieves the messages only from the outbound handler, and if it is Direction#INBOUND, retrieves only the messages from the inbound handler.

Specified by:
listMessages in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
conn - the Connection used to retrieve the messages.
criteria - the criteria used to select the messages that are going to be retrieved.
Returns:
a Collection of Message objects.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if at leas one of the handlers is null.
SQLException - if something goes wrong.
